description: User uploads a marketing services contract and receives a detailed risk assessment of the Intellectual Property Ownership clause, including related litigation cases, a quantitative risk score, mitigation language, and a downloadable PDF report.

messages.content: You are LexRiskScorer, an AI-powered legal risk scoring assistant. Use the provided tools to process contracts, evaluate clauses, and generate comprehensive risk reports.
I've attached the marketing services agreement (path: ./contracts/marketing_agreement.pdf). Please assess the risk of the "Intellectual Property Ownership" clause.
Uploading the contract to the system…
Extracting the "Intellectual Property Ownership" clause from the uploaded contract…

All work product created under this Agreement shall be owned by the Client. The Contractor hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such work product to the Client and waives any moral rights. The Contractor retains no ownership over any pre‑existing intellectual property.
Searching the litigation database for cases similar to this clause…

arguments.clause_text: All work product created under this Agreement shall be owned by the Client. The Contractor hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such work product to the Client and waives any moral rights. The Contractor retains no ownership over any pre‑existing intellectual property.

Calculating a quantitative risk score based on the retrieved case data…

messages.content: Generating mitigation suggestions to lower the identified risk…

arguments.clause_text: All work product created under this Agreement shall be owned by the Client. The Contractor hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such work product to the Client and waives any moral rights. The Contractor retains no ownership over any pre‑existing intellectual property.
arguments.risk_factors: Broad assignment language without carve‑outs for pre‑existing IP and lack of limitation on moral rights waiver

messages.content: Revised Clause: "All work product created under this Agreement shall be owned by the Client. The Contractor hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such work product to the Client, provided that such assignment does not affect any pre‑existing intellectual property of the Contractor. The Contractor waives any moral rights only to the extent necessary for the Client's exploitation of the work product, and retains the right to be identified as the author where applicable."
Compiling a full risk assessment report…

### Intellectual Property Ownership Clause Risk Assessment
- **Extracted Clause:** "All work product created under this Agreement shall be owned by the Client..."
- **Risk Score:** 78 / 100 (High risk)
- **Key Risk Drivers:** Broad assignment language, no carve‑out for pre‑existing IP, full moral‑rights waiver.
- **Relevant Litigation Cases:**
  1. *TechCo v. CreativeStudio* (CA) – $2.5 M liability for breach of implied IP warranty.
  2. *BrandWorks Ltd. v. MediaMakers* (NY) – Court invalidated overly broad assignment clause.
  3. *AdVantage Inc. v. DesignHub* (TX) – Settlement of $950 K over unconscionable IP transfer.
- **Mitigation Suggestion:**
  ```
  Revised Clause: "All work product created under this Agreement shall be owned by the Client. The Contractor hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such work product to the Client, provided that such assignment does not affect any pre‑existing intellectual property of the Contractor. The Contractor waives any moral rights only to the extent necessary for the Client's exploitation of the work product, and retains the right to be identified as the author where applicable."
  ```
You can download the complete PDF report, which includes detailed case summaries and all calculations, here: https://lexriskscorer.com/reports/report_9876.pdf
If you have any further questions or need a deeper dive into another clause, just let me know!
